name.text: Finding the Derivative of a Square Root Function at a Specific Point

questiontext.text:
Find the derivative of \(f(x)=\) {@fx@} at \(x={@cc@}\) using limits.

[[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Worked solution

We find the derivative of \(f(x)=\) {@fx@} at \(x={@cc@}\) using limits.

We have;

\( \begin{align} f'(x) & = \displaystyle \lim_{h\rightarrow 0} \frac{f(x+h)-f(x)}{h} \quad (\text{By definition}) \\ & = \displaystyle \lim_{h\rightarrow 0} \frac{{@aa@} \sqrt{{@bb@} (x+h)} -{{@aa@} \sqrt{{@bb@}x}}}{h} \\ &= \displaystyle \lim_{h\rightarrow 0} \left( \frac{{@aa@} \sqrt{{@bb@} (x+h)} -{{@aa@} \sqrt{{@bb@} x}}}{h} \right) \left( \frac{{@aa@} \sqrt{{@bb@} (x+h)} +{{@aa@} \sqrt{{@bb@} x}}}{{@aa@} \sqrt{{@bb@} (x+h)} +{{@aa@} \sqrt{{@bb@} x}}} \right)\\ &= \displaystyle \lim_{h\rightarrow 0} \frac{({@aa@} \sqrt{{@bb@} (x+h)})^2-({@aa@} \sqrt{{@bb@} x})^2}{h ({@aa@} \sqrt{{@bb@} (x+h)} +{{@aa@} \sqrt{{@bb@} x}})} \\ &=\displaystyle \lim_{h\rightarrow 0} \frac{({@aa^2@}) ( {@bb@} (x+h))-({@aa^2@})({@bb@}x)}{h ({@aa@} \sqrt{{@bb@} (x+h)} +{{@aa@} \sqrt{{@bb@} x}})} \\ &=\displaystyle \lim_{h\rightarrow 0} \frac{({@aa^2@})({@bb@}h)}{h ({@aa@} \sqrt{{@bb@} (x+h)} +{{@aa@} \sqrt{{@bb@} x}})} \\ &= \displaystyle \lim_{h\rightarrow 0} \frac{({@aa^2@})({@bb@})}{{@aa@} \sqrt{{@bb@} (x+h)} +{ {@aa@} \sqrt{{@bb@} x}}} \\ &= \displaystyle \lim_{h\rightarrow 0} \frac{({@aa@})({@bb@})}{\sqrt{{@bb@} (x+h)} +{ \sqrt{{@bb@} x}}} \\ &= \displaystyle \lim_{h\rightarrow 0} \frac{{@ev(aa*bb,simp)@}}{\sqrt{{@bb@} (x+h)} +{ \sqrt{{@bb@} x}}} \\ & = \frac{{@ev(aa*bb,simp)@}}{2 \sqrt{{@bb@} x}} \end{align} \)

Therefore, \(f'({@cc@}) = \frac{{@ev(aa*bb,simp)@}}{2 \sqrt{{@ev(bb*cc,simp)@}}} = {@ta@}\).

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

feedbackvariables.text: /*Node 2: Find a limit of the function at a given point*/ mistake1:at(fx,[x=cc]);

truefeedback.text: You determined the limit of the function using the formula \( \displaystyle \lim_{x \rightarrow {@cc@}} f(x) = f({@cc@}) \), which is incorrect. Check the worked solution!
